oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Maj. Gen. William T. Sherman
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Probably a reproduction, this letter from Gen. Sherman to Col. C. C. Walcott of the 46th Ohio Regt. concerns guerilla operations and fire coming from Randolph (Tenn." Sherman instructs Walcott to take steamers to [Fort] Randolph and "destroy the; place, leaving one house to mark the place." Sherman also directs the officer, "You may capture any slaves, horses or mules belonging to known rebels." Fort Randolph above Memphis was the site of an early war Confederate river battery.
